name: Peruvian Music
description: Music developed by the Peruvian people.

children.name: Chimaychi
children.description: Slower variant, traditionally lacking guitar or mandolin, found in the eastern provinces of Áncash department.

children.name: Chimaychi
children.description: Slower variant, traditionally lacking guitar or mandolin, found in the eastern provinces of Áncash department.

children.name: Cumbia peruana
children.description: Developed in Peru and diversified into various subgenres, each with its own regional influences.

children.name: Cumbia peruana
children.description: Developed in Peru and diversified into various subgenres, each with its own regional influences.

children.name: Huaylarsh
children.description: Festive Andean music with vibrant rhythm featuring saxophones and violins, typical of the central Peruvian region.

children.name: Huaylarsh
children.description: Festive Andean music with vibrant rhythm featuring saxophones and violins, typical of the central Peruvian region.

children.name: Música criolla peruana
children.description: Combination of African, Spanish, and Andean influences that originated after the time of the arrival of Spanish colonists and African slaves to Peru.

children.name: Música criolla peruana
children.description: Combination of African, Spanish, and Andean influences that originated after the time of the arrival of Spanish colonists and African slaves to Peru.

children.name: Tunantada
children.description: Originating in the central Peruvian region, characterized by cheerful and festive rhythm, with indigenous and mestizo influences.
